customer.description: The customer used for the order.

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: Metadata can be a string, number, boolean, date, datetime, image_url, object, geopoint, unknown. | related objects: campaign, voucher, publication, redemption, product, customer, order, order_item, loyalty_tier, promotion_tier.

key.description: Unique session identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description:
The type of session. Required to establish a new session. 

`LOCK`: Locks the following parameters within the session:

- redemption quantity by 1
- redemption gift credits specified with the requests
- redemption loyalty points specified with the request

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by `session.ttl_unit`.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

tracking_id.description: A tracking identifier of a user that validated a voucher. Identifier generated during voucher validation. This is a hashed customer source ID.

res_empty_json.description: Schema model for an empty json.
res_empty_json.title: Empty JSON

2_obj_campaign_object.title: Campaign Object
2_obj_campaign_object.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

referral_program.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: The number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

loyalty_tiers_expiration.description: Defines the expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance.title: Balance
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance.description: Defines the Balance expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier.

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points.

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.title: Balance Drop
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier based on a pure balance drop.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`BALANCE_DROP`: Tier expires when the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.title: Custom
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.description: Defines the custom conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`CUSTOM`: Tier expires after a certain time period passes following the instance the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

extend.description: Defines the amount of time the tier will remain active in ISO 8601 format. The expiration date counter starts at the moment when the customer reaches the minimum required points that are required to be in the tier. For example, a tier with a duration of P3M will be valid for a duration of 3 months.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.title: Calendar Periods
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration based on a list of available time periods.

type.description:
Period to which the expiration will be rounded to.    
- `MONTH`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the month. 
- `QUARTER`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the quarter. 
- `HALF_YEAR`: The expiration date will be rounded to the half year. 
- `YEAR`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the year.

strategy.description: Which portion of the given period should the rounding be applied to.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.title: Specific Month
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.description: Defines the custom rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: This mechanism describes a custom rounding for the expiration date.

strategy.description: Which portion of the given period should the rounding be applied to.

unit.description: Defines the type of unit of time in which the rounding period is counted.

value.description:
Value for the unit of time that the rounding applies to. Units for this parameter are defined by the `rounding.unit` parameter.    
- `0`: January
- `1`: February
- `2`: March
- `3`: April
- `4`: May
- `5`: June
- `6`: July
- `7`: August
- `8`: September
- `9`: October
- `10`: November
- `11`: December

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_points_in_per.title: Points in Period
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_points_in_per.description: Defines the Points in Period expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`POINTS_IN_PERIOD`: A customer qualifies for the tier only if the sum of the accumulated points in a **defined time interval** reaches the tier threshold.

qualification_period.description:
Customers can qualify for the tier if they collected enough points in a given time period. So, in addition to the customer having to reach a points range, they also need to have collected the points within a set time period. | **Period** | **Definition** | |:---|:---| | **Calendar Month** | Points collected in one calendar month
January, February, March, etc. | | **Calendar Quarter** | Points collected in the quarter
- January - March
- April - June
- July - September
- October - December | | **Calendar Half-year** | Points collected in the half-year
- January - June
- July - December | | **Calendar Year** | Points collected in one calendar year
January - December |

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points.    
`NEXT_PERIOD`: When the next qualification period starts.

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`END_OF_PERIOD`: Expire tier at the end of the period.    
`END_OF_NEXT_PERIOD`:  Expire tier at the end of the next period.

extend.description: Extend the expiration by adding extra months or days in ISO 8601 format. The tier will remain active even though it reaches its expiration time period. For example, a tier with a duration of `P3M` will be valid for an additional duration of 3 months and a tier with a duration of `P1D` will be valid for an additional duration of 1 day.

2_req_create_campaign_discount_voucher.title: Discount Campaign
2_req_create_campaign_discount_voucher.description: Request body schema for creating a discount voucher campaign using **POST** `/campaigns`.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: By choosing the auto update option you will create a campaign that can be enhanced by new vouchers after the time of creation (e.g. by publish vouchers method).    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign (size of campaign).

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to. Either pass this parameter OR the `category`.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to. Either pass this parameter or the `category` parameter.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id` parameter.

2_req_add_vouchers_to_campaign.title: Add Vouchers to Campaign Request Body

category_id.description: Unique category ID that you would like to assign to the voucher.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the voucher starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the voucher expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the voucher. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

code_config.description: Defines code's pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

total.description: Total valid and active campaigns matching the qualification criteria in given context.

2_obj_campaign_object_campaigns_qualific.title: Campaign Object
2_obj_campaign_object_campaigns_qualific.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

validation_rules_assignments.description: Stores information about validation rules assigned to the campaign.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: Array of validation rule assignment objects. Each validation rule assignment object contains details about the rule.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule assignment.

rule_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule.

related_object_id.description: ID of the object from which the rule originates.

related_object_type.description: Which object does the rule originate from: the  `voucher` itself or inherited from its parent `campaign`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of resource represented by the object. Default is `validation_rules_assignment`.

rule.description: Describes the details of the rule.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assigned to the campaign.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

referral_program.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: The number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaigns in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign objects.

total.description: Total number of campaigns.

3_obj_promotion_tier_object.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.
3_obj_promotion_tier_object.title: Promotion Tier Object

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated in ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

discount.description: The type of discount that will be applied to a customer's order.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the promotion tier is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a promotion tier with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the promotion tier will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a promotion tier with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the promotion tier is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_amount.description: Sum of order totals.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Promotion tier category ID.

categories.description: Details about the category assigned to the promotion tier.

3_obj_promotion_stack_object.title: Promotion Stack Object
3_obj_promotion_stack_object.description: Model schema for a promotion stack.

id.description: Unique promotion stack ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion stack was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion stack was updated in ISO 8601 format.

campaign_id.description: Promotion stack's parent campaign's unique ID.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

ids.description: Contains the list of tiers in a pre-defined sequence.

category_id.description: Promotion stack category ID.

categories.description: Details about the category assigned to the promotion stack.

3_req_create_promotion_stack.title: Create Promotion Stack Request Body
3_req_create_promotion_stack.description: Model schema for a creating a promotion stack using **POST** `/promotions/{campaignId}/stacks`.

ids.description: Contains the list of tiers in a pre-defined sequence.

category.description: Assign a category.

category_id.description: Instead of using the category name, you can alternatively assign a new category to a promotion stack using a unique category ID, i.e. `cat_0c9da30e7116ba6bba`.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about promotion tiers in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of promotion tier objects.

tiers.description: Contains array of promotion tier objects.

total.description: Total number of promotion tiers.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates whether there are more records for given filter parameters. This let's you know if you are able to run another request (with a different page or a different start date filter) to get more records returned in the results.

4_obj_reward_object.title: Reward Object
4_obj_reward_object.description: This is an object representing a reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Reward type.

parameters.description: Defines how the reward is generated.

stock.description: Configurable for **material rewards**. The number of units of the product that you want to share as reward.

redeemed.description: Defines the number of already invoked (successful) reward redemptions.

attributes.description: These properties are configurable for **material rewards**.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a material reward.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was updated in ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the reward in a structured format.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.title: Digital
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.description: These are parameters representing a digital (CAMPAIGN) reward. These can be in the form of discount coupons, gift card credits, or loyalty point credits.

campaign.description: Objects stores information about the campaign related to the reward.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Discount Coupons
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a discount coupon, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Gift Vouchers
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a gift voucher, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental amout to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Points on loyalty card
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing points on a loyalty card, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental points to be added to the current balance on the loyalty card.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.title: Pay with Points
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.description: These are parameters representing a Pay with Points (COIN) reward.

coin.description: Defines the ratio by mapping the number of loyalty points in `points_ratio` to a predefined cash amount in `exchange_ratio`.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the `points_ratio` property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the `exchange_ratio` property.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_MATERIAL.description: These are parameters representing products as a (MATERIAL) reward.

sku_id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify, of the SKU given as a reward.

attributes.description: These properties are configurable for material rewards.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a material reward.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the reward in a structured format.

4_req_reward_parameters_CAMPAIGN_LOYALTY.title: Points on loyalty card
4_req_reward_parameters_CAMPAIGN_LOYALTY.description: Configure a reward that adds points to a loyalty card. This type of reward is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Assign the reward to the campaign that contains the loyalty cards that will be replenished by the reward. Provide the unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental points to be added to the current balance on the loyalty card.

4_req_reward_parameters_CAMPAIGN_GIFT_VO.title: Gift Vouchers
4_req_reward_parameters_CAMPAIGN_GIFT_VO.description: Configure a reward that adds cash to a gift card. This type of reward is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

balance.description: The incremental amout to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

4_req_reward_parameters_CAMPAIGN_DISCOUN.description: Configure a reward that provides a discount coupon. This type of reward is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Assign the reward to the campaign that contains the vouchers that will be the source of the reward. Provide the unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

4_obj_reward_assignment_object.description: This is an object representing a reward assignment.

id.description: Unique reward assignment ID, assigned by Voucherify.

related_object_id.description: Related object ID to which the reward was assigned.

related_object_type.description: Related object type to which the reward was assigned.

parameters.description: Defines the cost of the reward.

loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: The number of points required to redeem the reward.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward assignment.
The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about reward assignments in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of reward assignments.

total.description: Total number of reward assignments.

loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: Number of points that will be subtracted from the loyalty card points balance if the reward is redeemed.

parameters.description: Defines the cost of the reward.

loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: Number of points that will be subtracted from the loyalty card points balance if the reward is redeemed.

5_obj_publication_object.title: Publication Object
5_obj_publication_object.description: This is an object representing a publication.

id.description: Unique publication ID, assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the publication.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the publication was created in ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer receiving the publication.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

channel.description: How the publication was originated. It can be your own custom channel or an example value provided here.

source_id.description: The merchants publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

customer.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

id.description: Unique customer ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchants customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs attached to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the customer.

voucher.description: Contains information about the voucher being published.

vouchers_id.description: Contains the unique internal voucher ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

channel.description: How the publication was originated. It can be your own custom channel or an example value provided here.

customer.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

voucher.description: Code of voucher being published.

campaign.description: Name of voucher's parent campaign or unique campaign ID that was assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `camp_dphuwqH7BOVkgh4JmpDtS32l`.

5_obj_publication_object_loyalty_card.title: Loyalty Card
5_obj_publication_object_loyalty_card.description: This is an object representing a publication of a loyalty card.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the voucher.

loyalty_card.description: Contains information about the loyalty card being published.

points.description: The incremental points to be added to the loyalty card as the initial balance on the card.

balance.description: The points balance after the incremental points are added to the loyalty card.

is_referral_code.description: Whether this voucher is a referral code.

5_obj_publication_object_gift_card.title: Gift Card
5_obj_publication_object_gift_card.description: This is an object representing a publication of a gift card.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the voucher.

gift.description: Contains information about the gift card being published.

amount.description: The incremental amount to be added as the initial balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: The credit balance on the gift card after the initial incremental amount is added to the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: How the credits are applied to the customer's order.

is_referral_code.description: Whether this voucher is a referral code.

6_req_validate_voucher.title: Validate Voucher Request Body
6_req_validate_voucher.description: Request schema model for validating a voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.title: Customer ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.description: You can pass the unique customer ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

6_req_rollback_redemption_customer_id.title: Customer ID
6_req_rollback_redemption_customer_id.description: You can pass the unique customer ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption rollback in this request.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id_strin.description: You can pass the unique customer ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.title: Customer Source ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the customer in Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of a customer that validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

6_req_rollback_redemption_customer_sourc.title: Customer Source ID
6_req_rollback_redemption_customer_sourc.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the customer in Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of a customer that redeemed a resource. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_id.title: Order ID
6_req_validate_voucher_order_id.description: You can pass the unique order ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_source_id.title: Order Source ID
6_req_validate_voucher_order_source_id.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the order in Voucherify.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

6_req_rollback_redemption_order_id.title: Order ID
6_req_rollback_redemption_order_id.description: You can pass the unique order ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption rollback of this request.

status.description: After a redemption rollback, Voucherify will default the order status to `CANCELED`. You can set the order status to one of the other options: `CREATED`, `PAID`, `FULFILLED`.

6_req_rollback_redemption_order_source_i.title: Order Source ID
6_req_rollback_redemption_order_source_i.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the order in Voucherify.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption rollback of this request.

status.description: After a redemption rollback, Voucherify will default the order status to `CANCELED`. You can set the order status to one of the other options: `CREATED`, `PAID`, `FULFILLED`.

6_req_validate_voucher_discount_code.title: Discount Code
6_req_validate_voucher_discount_code.description: Request schema model for validating a discount code voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_req_validate_voucher_gift_card.title: Gift Card
6_req_validate_voucher_gift_card.description: Request schema model for validating a gift card voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_req_validate_voucher_loyalty_card.title: Loyalty Card
6_req_validate_voucher_loyalty_card.description: Request schema model for validating a loyalty card voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card. If the user gives more points than he/she has on the loyalty card, the application will return an error code in response.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_req_session_lock_discount_code.title: Discount Code Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_discount_code.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_res_validate_voucher_false.title: Not Valid
6_res_validate_voucher_false.description: Response schema for a voucher that is not valid.

error.message: Voucher has been disabled and is not active anymore.

examples.reason: Customer must be a holder of a loyalty card.

error.message: You are not the right person.
You need more loyalty points to be able to redeem a reward.

examples.reason: order does not match validation rules

error.message: order does not match validation rules
error.details: Loyalty Card cannot be redeemed because of violated validation rules: val_RU9fm8GiQaRT

valid.description: Indicates whether the voucher is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body.

reason.description: System generated cause for the voucher being invalid in the context of the provided parameters.

error.description: Detailed failure cause for the invalid voucher if the reason has a translation defined in the Dashboard → Project Settings → Error Messages.

message.description: Customized error message.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.title: Amount Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.title: Percent Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.title: Fixed Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value. A fixed discounts sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

type.description: Type of discount.

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.    
    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount.description: Set a fixed valued for an order total or price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the fixed amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

source_id.description: The merchants order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created in ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated in ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

6_req_validate_promotion.title: Validate Promotion Request Body
6_req_validate_promotion.description: Request schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `/promotions/validation`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description: Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. Add `category` as a string in the array to include a `categories` object in the response.

6_res_validate_promotion.title: Validate Promotion Response Body
6_res_validate_promotion.description: Response schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `/promotions/validation`.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

promotions.description: Contains an array of promotion tier objects.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.
banner.example: Get 45% off items

discount.description: Contains information about the discount to be applied to the order.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

object.description: The type of object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

discount_amount.description: The calculated discount amount based on the discount type and effect.

applied_discount_amount.description: The effective discount amount that would be applied to the order.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Promotion tier category ID.

categories.description: Details about the category assigned to the promotion tier.

19_req_session_lock.title: Session Lock
19_req_session_lock.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **gift credits** and **loyalty points** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

19_res_session_lock.title: Session Lock
19_res_session_lock.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object contains information about the session key that was used to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

type.description: This session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfill the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order using a **pay with points** reward. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card.

19_req_redeemables_discount_referral_pro.title: Discount code, referral code, promotion tier, promotion stack

object.description: Redeemable object type.

id.description:
Redeemable code or unique ID such as:  
- discount code, referral code: `DiscountCode100`, `v_6ZPI2BLMtpc6zz8pQVjQgxJH3D4ac3ZT`  
- promotion tier: `promo_Mwy9XpA0TLctSGriM5kum0qp` 
- promotion stack: `stack_KxSD0GahLUg9ULB6TseGfUHJ`

19_req_redemptions.title: Redeem Stackable Discounts Request Body
19_req_redemptions.description: This data model represents the request body for redeeming multiple incentives.

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description:
Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redemption object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["order", "redemption"] | - Returns redemption object `metadata`.
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redemption object. | | ["redeemable", "redemption"] | - Returns each discount type's `metadata` in each child redemption object.
- Returns redemption object `metadata`. | | ["redemption"] | - Returns redemption object `metadata`. | | ["redeemable", "redemption", "category"] | - Returns each discount type's `metadata` in each child redemption object
- Returns redemption object `metadata`.
- Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

redeemables.description: An array of redeemables. You can combine `voucher`(s) and `promotion_tier`(s). Alternatively, send one unique`promotion_stack` in the array.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information. This object enables you to pass purchase transaction data. Read what properties you can use in the <!-- [Order object reference](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/10_obj_order_object) -->[Order object](ref:get-order).

19_req_validations.title: Validate Stackable Discounts Request Body
19_req_validations.description: This data model represents the request body for the `/validations` endpoint.

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description:
Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["category"] | - Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

redeemables.description: An array of redeemables. You can combine `voucher`(s) and `promotion_tier`(s). Alternatively, send one unique`promotion_stack` in the array.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information. This object enables you to pass purchase transaction data. Read what properties you can use in the <!-- [Order object reference](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/10_obj_order_object) -->[Order object](ref:get-order).

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a redemption object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the redemption in a structured format.

valid.description: The result of the validation. It takes all of the redeemables into account and returns a `false` if at least one redeemable is inapplicable. Returns `true` if all redeemables are applicable.

redeemables.description: Lists validation results of each redeemable. If a redeemable can be applied, the API returns `"status": "APPLICABLE"`.

status.description: Indicates whether the redeemable can be applied or not applied based on the validation rules. `SKIPPED` indicates that the validation stopped once it identified at least one unapplicable redeemable and did not continue to validate the given redeemable.

id.description: Redeemable ID, i.e. the voucher code.

object.description: Redeemable's object type.

result.description: Provides details for an inapplicable redeemable.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redeemable.

19_obj_voucher_object_discount_amount.title: Static Amount
19_obj_voucher_object_discount_amount.description: Amount discount type based on a static value.

type.description: Applies an amount discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount amount is based on a formula that dynamically calculates the discount.

19_obj_voucher_object_discount_amount_dy.title: Dynamic Amount
19_obj_voucher_object_discount_amount_dy.description: Amount discount type based on a formula.

type.description: Applies an amount discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount amount is based on a formula that dynamically calculates the discount.

19_obj_voucher_object_discount_percentag.title: Percentage
19_obj_voucher_object_discount_percentag.description: Percentage discount type applied to an order (static or dynamic) or a percentage discount type applied to items (static).

type.description: Applies a percentage discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: Percent taken off the subtotal amount. In case of the percent being calculated by the formula and applied to the order level, i.e. the `is_dynamic` parameter is `true`, this value becomes a dynamically calculated value that varies based on the formula.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount percentage is based on a formula that dynamically calculates the discount.

19_obj_voucher_object_discount_percentag.title: Dynamic Percentage for Items
19_obj_voucher_object_discount_percentag.description: Percentage discount type applied to items and based on a formula (dynamic).

type.description: Applies a percentage discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount percentage is based on a formula that dynamically calculates the discount.

19_obj_voucher_object_discount_fixed_ord.title: Fixed Order Amount
19_obj_voucher_object_discount_fixed_ord.description: Fixed discount type for an order.

type.description: Sets a fixed total on the cart and then calculates the discount to apply.

effect.description:
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|:---|:---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated dynamically during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. For example, if the fixed amount is set to equal $10 and the order amount equals $25, then the calculated discount will be $15. |

fixed_amount.description: Set a fixed valued for an order total. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the fixed amount is based on a formula that dynamically calculates the fixed amount.

type.description: Sets a new item price and then calculates the discount to apply.

effect.description:
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|:---|:---|
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is dynamically calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. During the redemption, prices for items will change only if the new price is lower than the original price. If the new product price you set is different from the product price in a collection, then the new product price will be passed during the redemption. If a prodct is in more than one collection, the price is always changed to the lowest price. The new price for products with several SKUs will force the price change for SKUs if their original price is higher than the new price. |

is_dynamic.description: Flag defaults to false because each item price could be defined separately and either based on a formula that dynamically calculates the discount or based on a fixed set price.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_type.description: The product or SKU deemed as free, chosen from the product  inventory (e.g. time, items), i.e. `sku_0a3efc90375d1217e2` or `prod_s3C0nDpr0DuC7`.

sku.description: Defines the product details of the product or the parent product in case of an SKU.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: SKU source ID.

product.description: Defines the product details of the product or the parent product in case of an SKU.

id.description: Unique (parent) product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product source ID.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the number of items is based on a formula.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

effect.description: Defines the effect for adding multiple item types.

units.description: Array of objects defining items to be offered for free. Each item type can have a different discount effect assigned.

items.description: Object defining a unit discount.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by a formula, this value is the result of the dynamic calculation.

unit_type.description: The product or SKU deemed as free, chosen from the product  inventory (e.g. time, items), i.e. `prod_0bc3bd76a61082e6b3` or `sku_0a3efc90701d121820`.

sku.description: Defines the product details of the product or the parent product in case of an SKU.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: SKU source ID.

product.description: Defines the product details of the product or the parent product in case of an SKU.

id.description: Unique (parent) product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product source ID.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the number of items is based on a formula.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Subtracts 1 shipping item from the subtotal.

unit_type.description: The shipping product deemed as free.

product.description: Defines the product details of the shipping product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `prod_5h1pp1ng`.

source_id.description: Product source ID.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the number of shipping items is based on a formula.
