19_obj_order_object_validation_res.title: Order
19_obj_order_object_validation_res.description: Contains the combined effect of all redeemables taken into account on the order object properties.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of order items showing the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

The amounts are consecutively built on the previous redeemable's effects, such that for each redeemable, the amounts are further reduced by the redeemable. The sequence in the request body is important because that will be the sequence the redeemables are applied one on top of the other.

`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

7_obj_redemption_object.title: Redemption Object
7_obj_redemption_object.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such an operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](ref:rollback-redemption).

7_obj_redemption_object_voucher.title: Redemption Object
7_obj_redemption_object_voucher.description: This is an object representing an attempted or successful voucher redemption.

7_obj_redemption_object_voucher_extended.title: Redemption Object
7_obj_redemption_object_voucher_extended.description: This is an object representing an attempted or successful voucher redemption.

7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.title: Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer that is related to the redemption.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchants customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_type.description:
Defines the related object.

| **Related Object** | **Definition** |
| :--- | :--- |
| voucher | Either a discount voucher, gift card, or loyalty card. |

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.title: Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `redemption`.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption if this particular redemption was issued through a stacked redemption.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer that is related to the redemption.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchants customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_type.description:
Defines the related object.

| **Related Object** | **Definition** |
| :--- | :--- |
| voucher | Either a discount voucher, gift card, or loyalty card. |

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

id.description: Unique voucher ID assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify.

7_obj_redemption_rollback_object_gift_ca.title: Rollback Gift Card
7_obj_redemption_rollback_object_gift_ca.description: This is an object representing a gift card redemption rollback.

id.description: Unique redemption rollback ID.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `redemption_rollback`.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption rollback occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

amount.description: The amount added back to the gift card expressed as the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00).

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the initial redemption.

reason.description: The reason for the redemption rollback.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption rollback.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption rollback was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption rollback. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption rollback. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer redeeming the gift card.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchants customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

7_filter_conditions_string.title: Filter by conditions
7_filter_conditions_string.description: Data filters used to narrow the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results. (multiple values)

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results. (multiple values)

$is.description: Value is exactly this value. (single value)

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

quantity.description: The maximum number of times a voucher can be redeemed.

redeemed_quantity.description: The number of times the voucher was redeemed successfully.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of `redemption_entries`.

total.description: Total number of redemption objects.

redemption_entries.description: Contains the array of successful and failed redemption objects.

7_req_redeem_voucher.title: Redeem Voucher Request Body
7_req_redeem_voucher.description: Request body schema for redeeming a voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/redemption`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against promotion tiers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description: Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. Add `category` as a string in the array to include a `categories` object in the response.

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

order.description: Order information.

[Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card. If the user gives more points than he/she has on the loyalty card, the application will return an error code in response.

8_obj_loyalty_campaign_object.title: Loyalty Campaign Object
8_obj_loyalty_campaign_object.description:
This is an object representing a loyalty campaign.  

The loyalty campaign object contains details about the loyalty campaign. You can use dedicated endpoints to list loyalty campaigns, list loyalty card holders, member activities, active rewards, earning rules, loyalty tiers for given loyalty campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

loyalty_tiers_expiration.description: Defines the expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

8_obj_loyalty_card_object.title: Loyalty Card Object
8_obj_loyalty_card_object.description: This is an object representing a loyalty card.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description: Object representing discount parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

assets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer ID of voucher owner.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or publish voucher API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

8_obj_loyalty_reward_object.title: Loyalty Reward Object
8_obj_loyalty_reward_object.description: This is an object representing a loyalty reward.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the loyalty reward object.

8_obj_loyalty_points_bucket.title: Loyalty Points Bucket Object
8_obj_loyalty_points_bucket.description: This is an object representing a loyalty points bucket.

id.description: Unique loyalty points bucket ID.

campaign_id.description: Unique parent campaign ID.

bucket.description: Defines the number of points stored in the given loyalty points bucket.

total_points.description: Total number of points in the loyalty points bucket.

status.description: Loyalty points bucket point status.

expires_at.description: Date when the number of points defined in the `bucket` object are due to expire.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty points bucket object was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty points bucket object was updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the loyalty points bucket.

8_obj_loyalty_tier_reward_object.title: Loyalty Tier Reward Object
8_obj_loyalty_tier_reward_object.description: This is an object representing a loyalty tier reward.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the loyalty tier reward.

8_res_get_loyalty_card_transactions.title: Get Loyalty Card Transactions Response Body

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of transaction objects.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of transactions. Each entry in the array is a separate transaction object.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates whether there are more records for given filter parameters. This let's you know if you are able to run another request (with a different page or a different start date filter) to get more records returned in the results.

1_obj_loyalty_card_transaction_object_re.title: Redemption
1_obj_loyalty_card_transaction_object_re.description: When loyalty points are used to pay for an order.

id.description: Unique transaction ID.

source_id.description: The merchants transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. In case of a redemption, this value is `null`.

campaign_id.description: Unqiue campaign ID of the voucher's parent campaign if it is part of campaign that generates bulk codes.

source.description: The channel through which the transaction took place, whether through the API or the the Dashboard. In case of a redemption, this value is `null`.

reason.description: Reason why the transaction occurred. In case of a redemption, this value is `null`.

type.description: Type of transaction.

details.description: Contains the detailed information about the transaction.

balance.description: Contains information on how the balance was affected by the transaction.

type.description: The type of voucher whose balance is being adjusted due to the transaction.

total.description: The available points prior to the transaction.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON.

points.description: The amount of points being used up in the transaction.

balance.description: The points balance on the loyalty card after the points in the transaction are subtracted from the loyalty card.

related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified, this is the ID that was assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. `voucher`.

order.description: Contains information about the original order.

id.description: Unique order ID.

source_id.description: The merchants order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

redemption.description: Contains information about the original redemption.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

reward.description: Contains information about the pay with points reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID.

related_transaction_id.description: This field is `null` in the case of this type of transaction.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the transaction was created in ISO 8601 format.

1_obj_loyalty_card_transaction_object_ac.title: Accrual
1_obj_loyalty_card_transaction_object_ac.description: When points are earned on the card through an earning rule.

id.description: Unique transaction ID.

source_id.description: The merchants transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. In case of a points accrual, this value is `null`.

campaign_id.description: Unqiue campaign ID of the voucher's parent campaign if it is part of campaign that generates bulk codes.

source.description: The channel through which the transaction took place, whether through the API or the the Dashboard.

reason.description: Reason why the transaction occurred. In case of a points accrual, this value is `null`.

type.description: Type of transaction.

details.description: Contains the detailed information about the transaction.

balance.description: Contains information on how the balance was affected by the transaction.

type.description: The type of voucher whose balance is being adjusted due to the transaction.

total.description: The available points after the transaction.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON.

points.description: The amount of points being added in the transaction.

balance.description: The points balance on the loyalty card after the points in the transaction are added to the loyalty card.

related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified, this is the ID that was assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. `voucher`.

order.description: Contains information about the original order.

id.description: Unique order ID.

source_id.description: The merchants order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

event.description: Contains information about the event that triggers the point accrual.

id.description: Unique event ID.

type.description: Type of event.

earning_rule.description: Contains information about the earning rule.

id.description: Unique earning rule ID.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

related_transaction_id.description: This field is `null` in the case of this type of transaction.

8_req_create_loyalty_card_transactions_e.title: Create Loyalty Card Transactions Export Request Body

parameters.description: Contains the parameters that define the data to be exported.

8_obj_export_loyalty_card_transactions.description: List of available fields and filters that can be exported with a loyalty card transactions export along with the sorting order of the returned data.
8_obj_export_loyalty_card_transactions.title: Export Transactions

order.description: How the export is filtered, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

fields.description:
Array of strings containing the data in the export. These fields define the headers in the CSV file. The array can be a combination of any of the following available fields: | **Field** | **Definition** | **Example Export** | |:---|:---|:---| | id | Unique transaction ID assigned by Voucherify. | vtx_0cb7811f1c07765800 | | type | Transaction type. | - `POINTS_EXPIRATION`
- `POINTS_ADDITION`
- `POINTS_REMOVAL`
- `POINTS_TRANSFER_OUT`
- `POINTS_ACCRUAL`
- `POINTS_REFUND`
- `POINTS_REDEMPTION` | | source_id | Custom source ID of the transaction if one was included originally. | source_id_custom | | reason | Contains the reason for the transaction if one was included originally. | | | balance | The loyalty card balance after the transaction. | | | amount | The amount of loyalty points being allocated during the transaction. This value can either be negative or positive depending on the nature of the transaction. | | | created_at | Timestamp in ISO 8601 format representing the date and time when the transaction was created. | 2022-03-09T09:16:32.521Z | | voucher_id | Unique Voucher ID. | v_dky7ksKfPX50Wb2Bxvcoeb1xT20b6tcp | | campaign_id | Parent campaign ID. | camp_FNYR4jhqZBM9xTptxDGgeNBV | | source| Channel through which the transaction was initiated. | - `API`
- `voucherify-web-ui`
- `Automation` | | details | More detailed information stored in the form of a JSON. | Provides more details related to the transaction in the form of an object. | | related_transaction_id | Unique transaction ID related to a receiver/donor card in the case of a points transfer from/to another card. | vtx_0c9afe802593b34b80 |

8_obj_export_transactions_object.title: Export Object
8_obj_export_transactions_object.description:
This is an object representing an export. 

 Using this endpoint, you can export [loyalty card transactions](ref:list-loyalty-card-transactions) as a CSV file. This functionality works asynchronously and comes down to the following steps:  
* create an export object and return its `id` so you can track its `status`
* trigger a CSV file generation, change the status to `SCHEDULED`
* when the generation is over, store the file in S3 and change the `status` to `DONE`
* now you can (ref:download-export) it

With `parameters` you can select which `fields` will be exported. An export request will almost always result in a single file being generated by the system. However, when your volume of data is large, the system may split the results into multiple chunks.

id.description: Unique export ID.

object.description: The type of object being represented. This object stores information about the `export`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the export was scheduled in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: Status of the export. Informs you whether the export has already been completed, i.e. indicates whether the file containing the exported data has been generated.

channel.description: The channel through which the export was triggered.

exported_object.description: The type of exported object.

result.description: Contains the URL of the CSV file.

url.description: URL of the CSV file location. It contains the `token` used for authorization in the <!-- [Download export](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1exports~1{export_Id}/get) -->[Download export](ref:download-export) method.

user_id.description: Identifies the specific user who initiated the export through the Voucherify Dashboard; returned when the `channel` value is `WEBSITE`.

8_obj_loyalty_tier_object.title: Loyalty Tier Object
8_obj_loyalty_tier_object.description:
This is an object representing a loyalty tier.  

Loyalty tiers are used to create a loyalty program with different levels of membership and varied earning rules and rewards based on customers tiers.

id.description: Unique loyalty tier ID.

campaign_id.description: Unique parent campaign ID.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the loyalty tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a loyalty tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the loyalty tier in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was updated in ISO 8601 format.

earning_rules.description: Contains a list of earning rule IDs and their points mapping for the given earning rule.

rewards.description: Contains a list of reward IDs and their points mapping for the given reward.

config.description: Defines loyalty tier range in points.

points.description: Defines range of loyalty tier in points.
Defines range of loyalty tier in points.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the loyalty.

8_obj_earning_rule_object_no_validation_.title: Earning Rule Object

8_obj_earning_rule_object_order_paid.description: This is an object representing an earning rule for a paid order.
8_obj_earning_rule_object_order_paid.title: Earning Rule Object for Order Paid

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the earning rule object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `order.paid` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to an order status `PAID`.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `earning_rule`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the earning rule. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an earning rule object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the earning rule in a structured format.

8_req_update_earning_rule_object_order_p.title: Earning Rule Object for Order Paid

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the earning rule. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an earning rule object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the earning rule in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

custom_event.description: Contains the schema id of a custom event. **Required** for the custom event option in `event`.

schema_id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a custom event schema. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `custom_event_name` the name of a custom event defined in the Dashboard → **Project Settings** → **EVENT SCHEMA** → **Add event definition**. Read more on defining [custom events](https://support.voucherify.io/article/111-custom-events).

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `earning_rule`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the earning rule. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an earning rule object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the earning rule in a structured format.

8_obj_earning_rule_object_tier.description: This is an object representing an earning rule for tiers.
8_obj_earning_rule_object_tier.title: Earning Rule Object for Tiers

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the earning rule object.

An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `customer.loyalty.tier.joined` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer joining a tier    
- `customer.loyalty.tier.left` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer leaving a tier    
- `customer.loyalty.tier.upgraded` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer's tier being upgraded    
- `customer.loyalty.tier.downgraded` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer's tier being upgraded    
- `customer.loyalty.tier.prolonged` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer's tier being prolonged
